data.title: Great family food.
data.text: Good homemade Italian food at reasonable prices.  When ordering pizza by the slice be careful, the slices are HUGE! And the stromboli is monstrous!!!

data.title: Horrible experience
data.text: I placed my order with Venice numerous times and loved their shrimp pizza and subs.. unfortunately today 7/11/15 I placed a order for  shrimp pizza and three Philly cheese steak  subs and to my surprise the food was horrible,  the Philly cheese steak was not properly done, the cheese was not melted and had to be placed in the microwave just to melt it. And the pizza was nowhere near the quality that I was accustomed to at Venice.  To my surprise Venice has changed owners as of two months ago. This after 5 years of eating here, is the worst EVER.  New owners here at Venice are horrible! And the manager needs to rethink his managerial skills,  maybe take some courses, nor only did he hold the phone in hesitation mode,  he did not even attempt to resolve my issues.  He was a drab to talk to.

data.title: Decent food, good prices
data.text:
I have mixed feelings about Venice Italian Pizza and Subs.  The delivery to the hotel was efficient and painless. I was able to place the order online, received email and text confirmation. The delivery timeframe estimate was pretty accurate, and the prices are  reasonable.  

I had the opportunity to try a few items from the menu.  The chicken parmigiana was interesting.  The chicken was delicious, but the spaghetti it was served with I didn't enjoy at all.  There was also a piece of so-called garlic bread served with it.  It didn't taste bad, but it wasn't anything exciting. It was very plain. I dipped it in ranch dressing and this helped. The side salad was fine. I tried a couple of the Cajun fries, they were just crinkle cut fries with a bunch of Cajun seasoning. They tasted fine, nothing exciting. Finally, the chocolate cake was pretty good. Fairly moist and the icing was good. 

Overall, a good meal and good service. Just wish the food was all consistently delicious instead of hit or miss.

data.title: OK, it's really about the Mexican food by Maria
data.text:
It is all about Maria.  She gets there early in the morning to prepare the beans - pinto and black - no canned stuff. With her pico de gallo and the rice,  I am in vegan heaven - hint: pintos are better.  If I want to notch it up a bit and add a little dairy, the guacamole rocks.  It has a little sour cream in it - just a titch.  And Maria is so sweet.  No comment about the other fare.
Not a pretty place...always get my food to go.
